subject: Re: [junit] can't install junit
msgSnippet: HI, I read the  I get a ClassNotFoundException when I use the LoadingTestRunner faq and it is a little vague.  I understand that I have to modify the
messageBody:
HI,

I read the " I get a ClassNotFoundException when I use the
LoadingTestRunner" faq and it is a little vague. I understand that I have
to modify the excluded.properties file, but what do I add to it? How does
it know which classes to try and load? Does it check my CLASSPATH? Is there
a way I can find out exactly which class it can't load? Why isn't this
information output when the test fails?

Thanks again

----- Original Message -----
From: "Robert Sartin" <robert_sartin@...>
To: "Peter Bismuti" <peterb@...>
Sent: Friday, January 19, 2001 1:24 PM
Subject: Re: [junit] can't install junit


>
> --- Peter Bismuti <peterb@...> wrote:
> > Hi, thanks for the response. I'm pretty familiar with the docs and I
> > don't
>
> JUnit 3.4?
>
> Check the faq in doc/faq/faq.html of the distribution. The section on
> "I get a ClassNotFoundException when I use the LoadingTestRunner" for
> some stuff.
>
>
> The properties are probably the worst documented part of junit right
> now....
>
> Regards,
>
> Rob
